intro: Hesperis carnosa, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Hesperis carnosa is a biennial or short-lived perennial, often growing to a height of 30–60 cm. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
